description.narrative: The programme will assist in promoting rule of law through provision of support to the justice and security sectors in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) Province.

In 7 districts of Malakand division and three district of southern KP (Kohat, Bannu and DI Khan) Rule of Law programme is assisting vulnerable population including women and poor litigants of the districts, duty bearers including district judiciary, police, prosecution etc, visitors visiting distric

In 7 districts of Malakand division these include Shangla, Swat Buner, Malakand, Dir Lower, Dir Upper and Chitral, Rule of Law programme is implementing the same nature of activities targeting vulnerable population including women and poor litigants of the districts, duty bearers including district

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

1.1: 45 (Number of network members increased and endorsed the drafted constitution) 1.2: Scale 1 (LADs Not Established) 1.3: 0 (Number of human rights focal points (50% women) trained to provide services at LADs) 3.1: Scale 2 (Limited Capacity) 3.2: Scale 2 (Limited case management and court administration with identified gaps) (Mapping completed, gaps identified but not addressed) 4.1: Scale 2 (Limited Capacity) 4.2: Scale 1 (Limited trust and accountability in target areas) 4.3: 0 (Number of training courses/SOPs focused on refugees developed for community policing forums) 4.4: Scale 1 (Limited Extent) 4.5: Scale 1 (Limited capacity) 4.6: Scale1 (To a small extent) (Hiring of consultant for planning, designing and construction supervision) 6.1: 0 (Number of studies conducted on the gender, socio economic, dispute resolution and justice system in merged districts) 6.2: 0 (Number of TNAs conducted for ROL and justice sector institutions) 6.3: Scale 1 (Not at all) (No TNAs conducted) 6.4: 0 (Number of indigent clients accessing legal aid services and benefiting from legal awareness) 7.1: Scale 1 (Limited Capacity) (No prosecution library, limited access of lawyers to law books, no strategy for addressing gender issues in rule of law institutions, limited capacity of judicial academy in terms of knowledge, skill and infrastructure)

1.1: 7 [Desc: (a) development of Anti Narcotics Force gender strategy, (b) development of GB ROL Roadmap, c) Revision of DLEC rules 2011, d) development of rules under the KP forensic science agency act 2020, e) Development of revised prison act and rules, f) Development of training policy and training curriculum for KP prison g) Development of training manual of reclamation and probation departments] 2.1: male (KP+Bal.)= 3475 Female (KP+Bal.)= 2075 Marginalized groups (KP+Bal = minorities+ juveniles + disabled =150 Toal (KP+Bal)=5550 2.2:Women (KP+Bal.)= 2750 Men (KP+Bal.)= 3050Marginalized groups (KP+Bal = minorities + juveniles + disabled =100 Toal (KP+Bal)=6900 3.1: a)Yes[Desc: 1 set of SOPs for Virtual Courts (GBV Courts) of High Court finalized and implemented] b) Yes[Desc: 3 manuals (justice sector training manuals in which human rights are imbedded) (No.Policies/regulations developed but not implemented) 3.2: (KP: Male=45, Female=05 total=50); (GB: Male=15, Female=05) Bal=Sindh=Punjab=AJK=TBD 3.3: KP: Male=48, Female=02 = Total=50; Bal.: Male=, Female= 0 Total=0

1.1: 06 results achieved except the DLEC rules which will be completed in 2022. The description of results is as below: 1) Anti-Narcotic Force Gender Strategy Developed, 2) GB ROL Roadmap developed, 3) Rules developed under the KP forensic science agency act 2020, 4) Prison Act and Rules revised and amended, 5) Training policy and training curriculum developed for KP prison, 6) Training manual of reclamation and probation department developed 2.1: Formal mechanism: 67 a) Male (KP + Bal): 10 + 0 = 10 b) Female (KP + Bal): 56 + 0 + 56 c) Marginalized (KP + Bal): 1 + 0 = 1 2.2: Informal mechanism: Male (KP) + Female (KP) = 3454 Total (KP + Bal) = Women (KP + Bal) = 1798 Men (KP + Bal) =5700 Marginalized Groups (KP + Bal = minorities + juveniles + disabled) = 721 Total (KP + Bal) = 8219 3.1: a) 1 set of SOPs developed for GBV virtual courts, b) 6 training manuals developed 3.2: a) KP: Men = 32, Women = 04 Total = 36, b) GB: Men = 13, Women = 03 Total = 16 Note: In KP 70 more judges will be trained in November and December 3.3: a) KP: Men = 72, Women = 0 Total = 72 Note: In KP 140 more court staff will be trained in November and December

1.1: 110 (Number of network members increased and endorsed the drafted constitution) 1.2: Scale 3 (LADs established and operationalized) 1.3: 30 (Number of human rights focal points (50% women) trained to provide services at LADs) 2.1: 1 (Number of community paralegals manuals/ SOPs developed, reviewed, updated) 3.1: Scale 3: Moderate Capacity (Training evaluation system developed; Research Policy developed and research staff are trained on research methodology to conduct publishable research) 3.2: Scale 3 (Partially Improved case management and court administration with identified gaps (Mapping completed, gaps identified and partially addressed) (gaps identified under PHC strategy and partially addressed through establishment of mechanism at PHC for redressal and coordination including training and technical assistance in drafting Cr.PC) 4.1: Scale 4 (Training Manual/SOPs developed, reviewed, implemented and orientation provided) 4.2: Scale 2 (Very Partial trust and accountability target areas) (MPS established and linked with communities; JPTC II construction completed) 4.3: Scale 3 To moderate extent (Hiring of civil work vendor and implementation of civil work 4.4: 40 women accommodated at ANF premises 4.5: No target for 2019 4.6: No target for 2019 5.1: No target for 2019 6.1: 1 (Number of conference/workshops organized) 6.2: Scale 4 (Justice sector capacity needs identified, and moderately addressed) 6.3: 675 (Number of indigent clients accessing legal aid services and benefiting from legal awareness at least 40% women) 6.4:No target for 2019 7.1: Scale 2 (strategies developed for addressing gender issues in rule of law institutions, workshop on informal and formal justice systems organized) 7.2: Scale 4: To a full extent (Training College is established & operationalized Handing over of the facility)

1.1: 130 (Number of Women Lawyer network members increased) 1.2: 6 LADs establishment operationalized and linked with 7 MPSs. 1.3: 30 (16 women) (LADs established a Legal Aid Unit and Human Rights Focal Point) 2.1: 1 (Community Paralegals Manual revised and updated) 3.1: The Programme with support from PHC and KPJA analyzed the current RoBs of PHC Human Rights Cell. Research Policy for KPJA developed. 3.2: 160 Court Staff trained on computer skills and Case-flow management information system. Developed draft Rules under Criminal Procedure Code (Cr. P. C) to support criminal courts function smoothly. 4.1: Police Training Policy developed. After approval of policy by Police Board, implementation will be initiated. A module on refugees for Police Training College Hangu developed. 4.2: 3 MPSs established. 26 police personnel of three MPSs trained on gender responsive policing. Construction of JPTC-II under original plan completed. Due to rupees deprecation additional civil works underway. 4.3: Civil works initiated at the Prosecution Academy Peshawar. 4.4: Architectural designs finalized. Civil works will be initiated in March 2020. 4.5: No target for 2019 4.6: No target for 2019 5.1: No target for 2019 6.1: The conference will be organized during first quarter of 2020 as partner organization received NOC with an 8 months delay. 6.2: 3 Training needs assessments for prosecution, lawyers and ADR completed. Training manuals for the lawyers and prosecution also developed. Training will be initiate in January 2020. 6.3: 6,335 (1,645 women) community members from NMDs attended legal awareness sessions. 6.4: No target for 2019 7.1: 1 Gender Strategy developed for the Law Enforcement Agencies (LEAs) Balochistan to encourage women join LEAs. The strategy is approved by LEAs and launched. 7.2: Vendor hired for the preparation of designs for PTC Quetta. Civil work will be initiated in March 2020.
